title: Citizenfour
creator_credit: Kirsten Johnson, RADiUS-TWC, The Bertha Foundation and JustFilms / Ford Foundation
headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
brief_description: Laura Poitras blurs the line between documentary and investigative journalism. Poitras was one of three journalists confided in by whistleblower Edward Snowden when he shared classified documents that detailed global government surveillance. Telling his story earned Poitras a Pulitzer, while Citizenfour won an Oscar.

constellations_primary.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_primary.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

constellations_other.name: Orwell & Snowden
constellations_other.description: Explores Orwell as a representation of the NSA, and the infamous Snowden leak.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

creator_credit_for_label: Kirsten Johnson, RADiUS-TWC, The Bertha Foundation and JustFilms / Ford Foundation
headline_credit_for_label: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
description: In June 2013, Laura Poitras and reporter Glenn Greenwald flew to Hong Kong for the first of many meetings with Edward Snowden. She brought her camera with her.
description_for_label: In June 2013, Laura Poitras and reporter Glenn Greenwald flew to Hong Kong for the first of many meetings with Edward Snowden. She brought her camera with her.
